title: Fact Check: Did former CJI Ranjan Gogoi defend Baba Ramdev over Coronil? Here’s the truth | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A screenshot of a tweet attributed to the former Chief Justice of India, Ranjan Gogoi, is being shared on social media.

In the tweet, he is defending Baba Ramdev and Patanjali’s new anti-COVID-19 drug, Coronil.

NewsMobile fact-checked the above post and found it to be misleading.

We searched for media reports on the same but did not find anything credible.

Then we checked the twitter handle from which the tweet was made (@SGBJP) and found that that the tweet was posted on June 25, 2020.

The bio of this Twitter handle clearly stated that the account is a parody account.

It should also be noted that Ranjan Gogoi doesn’t have any official Twitter account.

Hence, based on the above information, we can conclude that the post in question is misleading.
